show.title: Steel Magnolias
show.headline: Big hair, big laughs, and a few tears

event.title: <show-title>Steel Magnolias</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: It takes effort to party like this
event.description:
Join us for a trip to the best place on Earth, home of big hair and even bigger gossip: Truvy's Beauty Spot.

In this charming little parlor, you don't just get your hair and nails did – you get vital life lessons, like the fact that there's no such thing as natural beauty. Thanks, Truvy Jones (Dolly Parton)! Then there's Clairee Belcher (Olympia Dukakis), reminding you that the only thing that separates us from the animals is our ability to accessorize. And without Ouiser Boudreaux (Shirley MacLaine), how would you discover that it's possible to be in a bad mood for 40 years?

So tease up your hair, grab your bestie, and join us for this special interactive screening of STEEL MAGNOLIAS, featuring fun surprises like armadillo squeeze toys, beauty caps, and more. You’ll laugh, cry, and quote along with the fiercest females in the South. It'll be even better than a slice of armadillo cake.

show.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2
show.headline: The epic finale that will live forever

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 2

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 2

posterImages.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 2

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: We've seen your future – it involves you having a blast at this epic movie party
event.description:
After all this time, we finally understand why we’ve been so obsessed with TWILIGHT SAGA Movie Parties. It was this one, BREAKING DAWN PART 2…we imprinted on it and want you to too! It’s a wolf thing, we have no control over it, but that doesn’t mean we can’t still have fun.

The epic conclusion to TWILIGHT sees newly vamped Bella the proud mom of a creepy, rapidly growing, werewolf-imprinted, half-vampire/half-human baby with a totally normal name. The Volturi aren’t too happy about that so the Cullens and their allies will have to prepare for an all-out decapitation fest. Prepare for the final battle with some magnifico-themed props, including some fake IDs in case you need to skip town, mini hands that can feel into your mind, a half-vamp baby that grows real fast, and a film gradient keychain featuring all of the films’ unique color filters.

No one has loved a Movie Party series as much as we love this one (with one exception). We thought it would last forever but forever isn’t as long as we’d hoped, so be sure to book your seats while they last.

event.title: <show-title>Pulp Fiction</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Do the twist at our PULP FICTION Movie Party
event.description:
PULP FICTION shook audiences around the world when it first arrived 30 years ago, lifting elements from a wide array of time-worn stories and weaving them together into something truly new. Considering its impact on film history and just how damn watchable it is, any time is a great time to celebrate this iconic achievement.

When you arrive, we'll provide you with an “adrenaline” shot pen in case you need a shot to the heart, candy cigarettes (just pretend they're Red Apple band), and a yellow coffee mug so you can enjoy some "serious gourmet sh*t" just like Jules.

So don’t be a square, daddio. Grab your honey bunny and cruise on down to the most fun, most bloody, most groovy Movie Party in town.

event.title: <show-title>Mamma Mia!</show-title> <event-type-title>Feast</event-type-title>
event.headline: Take a chance on our delectable three-course feast
event.description:
Did you know the original title of ABBA’s groovy call for a little late-night company was actually “Gimme! Gimme! Gimme! (A Meal and a Mug)”? While that’s obviously not true, it definitely would be if they had known about our Mother’s Day Feast when they wrote it.

We’re pairing MAMMA MIA!, the delightful mother-daughter, mystery-dad musical, with a three-course prix fixe menu, including Herb Cheese Toast, a Chicken Shawarma Couscous Bowl, and Pineapple Toffee Jarred Cake. In addition to this light, refreshing, yet totally satisfying feast, every attendee will walk away with our newest must-have merch – our Alamo Blossom Mug. Whether you’re bringing your mom, your kid, or just an appetite, we know that you’ll have a great time when all is said and done.

show.title: UHF
show.headline: Don't touch that dial!

event.title: <show-title>UHF</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Don't touch that dial!
event.description:
To celebrate the cult comedy UHF, we're throwing a Movie Party! Not only do you get to watch this uproarious classic with a theater full of fellow "Weird Al" fans, but we'll also have all sorts of fun props to help you get in on the action, including TV signal glasses, gummy hot dogs, and fake mustaches.

So throw on a Hawaiian shirt, grab a spatula, and join us as we cheer on "Weird Al" in his fight to keep his local UHF station out of the hands of evil corporate overlords.

show.title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
show.headline: Makes Ben-Hur look like an epic

landscapeHeroImage.altText: MONTY PYTHON AND THE HOLY GRAIL

portraitHeroImage.altText: MONTY PYTHON AND THE HOLY GRAIL

posterImages.altText: MONTY PYTHON AND THE HOLY GRAIL

event.title: <show-title>Monty Python and the Holy Grail</show-title> <event-type-title>Quote-Along Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Recite the sacred words with your favorite knights
event.description:
Greetings, old women, it is I, Arthur, your king!

Follow me into this special quote-along screening of our quest to seek the Holy Grail, but only if ye be men of valor. For the entrance to this screening is guarded by a creature so foul, so cruel that no man yet has fought with it and lived. Bones of full fifty men lie strewn about its lair. So, brave knights, if you do doubt your courage or your strength, come no further, for death awaits you all with nasty, big, pointy teeth.

Fear not, ye’ will be equipped with themed props for the journey, including a mighty steed (coconuts) and a knightly weapon (inflatable sword) to take on all the animated monsters and Frenchmen on your path to glory.

show.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1
show.headline: Forever is only the beginning

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 1

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 1

posterImages.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 1

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Bella's pregnant – help us throw her a movie party baby shower
event.description:
Our TWILIGHT SAGA Movie Party Saga is nearly over with the first chapter of its epic conclusion – BREAKING DAWN PART 1.

Bella has finally chosen between Team Edward and Team Jacob, and after a blending of the vamp and human families, it’s off to the isle of Esme for a honeymoon. Unfortunately, their bliss is short-lived when Bella gets knocked up by a half-vamp, rapidly growing baby – and you thought you were done with newborns after ECLIPSE. Join us as we celebrate the happy couple on their creepy little bundle of joy with themed props like styrofoam cups perfect for that tasty blood babies crave, butter mints you could serve at a wedding, red glasses that let you look through the eyes of a vampire, and red eye rings to show off your vamp-tastic new look.

No measure of time partying with you is enough, but we’ll take all we can get, so book those tickets ASAP. If you don’t, the treaty is totally void, at least in Sam’s mind (that guy can be a real stickler).

show.title: Uncle Buck
show.headline: He's crude. He's crass. He's family.

event.title: <show-title>Uncle Buck</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Do we have an UNCLE BUCK Movie Party? Fortunately, yes!
event.description:
Are we throwing an UNCLE BUCK Movie Party? Yes. Will it be fun? Big time. Will there be themed props? Always are. Will it be your new favorite Movie Party? Probably. Are we running out of questions for this bit? Sure are. Look, we can’t all make it to 38 questions in a row, that takes real skill.

Starring the incomparable John Candy in one of his greatest roles ever, UNCLE BUCK is quintessential John Hughes and even features a pre-HOME ALONE Macaulay Culkin in his debut film. The jokes are rapid-fire, the pancakes are huge, the feels are real, and the props are themed – including giant pancake frisbees, yellow kitchen gloves, and more.

show.title: The Big Lebowski
show.headline: The Coen Bros.' slacker odyssey really ties the room together

event.title: <show-title>The Big Lebowski</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: It's the greatest movie party ever, but that's just like, uh, our opinion, man
event.description:
You want a movie party? We can get you a movie party, believe me. There are ways, Dude. You don't wanna know about it, believe me.

With its endlessly quotable dialogue, twist-filled mystery, and iconic characters, THE BIG LEBOWSKI has become a fixture of modern pop culture. That’s why we’re putting together a movie party to celebrate the greatness that is El Duderino (we’re not into the whole “brevity” thing).

When you arrive, we’ll provide you with a bowling pin keychain to commemorate the forever-two-steps-behind Donny Kerabatsos, glow sticks that’ll make you feel like you’re a part of The Dude’s epic dream sequences, and much more.

So throw on your favorite shabby sweater and roll on down for THE BIG LEBOWSKI Movie Party. It’ll be far out.

eventType.title: Movie Party
eventType.headline: Celebrate your fave movies with fun, interactive props, themed drinks, and more
eventType.description: Spanning all genres, Alamo Drafthouse Movie Parties are an immersive, interactive experience for cinema fans featuring fun props, themed drinks, and more.

titleCardImage.altText: Movie Party TC

show.title: Road House
show.headline: It's a dirty job, but somebody's gotta do it

event.title: <show-title>Road House</show-title>
event.headline: “Pain don’t hurt”
event.description:
ROAD HOUSE! Y’all, we’re so excited for this one. Patrick Swayze is DALTON, James Dalton, a hunky professional New York “cooler” who is recruited by struggling businessman Frank Tillman (Kevin Tighe) to become the new head of security at the Double Deuce, a rough and rowdy venue with a dangerous clientele. Dalton isn’t your standard bouncer though, he’s different. He’s Swayze, baby. Dalton has a hard body and the heart of a…poet. A monk? An otherworldly being of balance? Who knows what kind of heart Dalton has beating in his gorgeous sweaty chest, all we know is that he’s bringing his unique brand of bar room justice to the seedy underbelly of Jasper, Missouri, and nothing will ever be the same. Will Dalton be able to calm the tumultuous trajectory of the Double Deuce and woo the beautiful Dr. Elizabeth Clay (Kelly Lynch), or will the evil machinations of foppish crime lord Brad Wesley (Ben Gazzara) and his beefy toughs get the better of him? And whoa, Sam Elliot is here as Wade Garrett, Dalton’s mentor aka daddy aka former lover! This movie is nuts.

Patrick Swayze was a one-of-a-kind talent gone far too soon, and his filmography is rife with classic queer-coded films. And I’m not even talking about the more overt TO WONG FOO of it all. From DIRTY DANCING to ROAD HOUSE, GHOST to POINT BREAK, this legend made iconically queer and campy films that have charmed generations. Come on down to the Alamo Drafthouse and kick off the summer season with one of the most important films about roadside music venues ever made. And remember what Dalton always says: Be nice. (Micheal Foulk)

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Mask (1994)
show.headline: From zero to hero

event.title: <show-title>The Mask (1994)</show-title>
event.headline: “S-ssss-ssss-sssss-smokin'!”
event.description:
Men. YIKES. Throw a weird mask on a man? EVEN WORSE. Sorry. Let me start over. It’s part two of Queer Film Theory 101’s journey into the dark psyche of the '90s American male with the cartoonish and absurd 1994 classic THE MASK (all caps feel appropriate) staring one of our favorite fractured masculinity clowns, Jim Carrey, and featuring the amazing debut of Cameron Diaz. Just like a be-dragged Bugs Bunny seducing Elmer Fudd, THE MASK is surprisingly queer when you think about it. THE MASK is giving chaos bisexual by way of Tex Avery.

Stanly Ipkiss, a hapless bank employee and certified “nice guy,” happens upon an ancient mask of indeterminant and likely problematically racist origin. When he pops it on his wormy little mug, he’s suddenly transformed into the uncomfortably horny anti-hero THE MASK! Is this new persona just the ticket that Stanley needs to assert himself and win the affection of the sultrily Jessica Rabbit-coded Tina? Or will the unbridled and violent masculinity of his new alter-ego cause him to lose everything…perhaps even his life?

Chuck Russell’s adaptation of Doug Mahnke and John Arcudi’s much darker Dark Horse Comic series became one of the top-grossing films of 1994. Due to the success of THE MASK, ACE VENTURA: PET DETECTIVE, and DUMB AND DUMBER (all released in 1994), Jim Carrey became a household name, and millions of children across the world became a little more annoying. C’mon, you remember running around yelling, “Somebody stop me!” at anyone who would listen, right? What a nightmare. (Micheal Foulk)

show.title: Carrie (1976)
show.headline: Thanks, Stephen & Brian, for ruining proms for good

event.title: <show-title>Carrie (1976)</show-title>
event.headline: Stephen King and Brian De Palma’s chilling classic
event.description: Thanks to Stephen King and Brian DePalma, prom was transformed from a symbol of happiness to a violent hellscape of death. High five! Based on King’s novel, CARRIE follows wide-eyed outsider Carrie White (the incredible Sissy Spacek) as she endures the stuff of teenage girl nightmares – a public shaming by her classmates after the arrival of her first period. At home, Carrie is taunted by her mother (Piper Laurie) with religious nonsense and talk of “dirty pillows.” What’s a girl to do but transfer all that rage into telekinetic powers? With DePalma’s bag of stylized tricks and King’s knack for pulpy shocks, CARRIE is a special kind of horror masterpiece that only comes along once every 2000 years.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Mirror Mirror (1990)
show.headline: Marina Sargenti’s teen horror triumph

event.title: <show-title>Mirror Mirror (1990)</show-title>
event.headline: Marina Sargenti’s teen horror triumph
event.description:
Before THE CRAFT, there was MIRROR MIRROR. Co-written by sisters Annette and Gina Cascone and directed by Marina Sargenti, the film follows high school goth Megan (Rainbow Harvest, a dead ringer for Winona Ryder’s Lydia Deetz character in BEETLEJUICE) as she deals with typical teenage stuff: crushes, bullies, and a haunted mirror that grants her supernatural powers. MIRROR MIRROR combines YA vibes straight out of a Christopher Pike novel with plenty of R-rated thrills. But the film’s most notable – and enjoyable – aspect is its nuanced portrayal of relationships between women, which was rare for the horror genre in 1990.

Screening the restoration

show.title: Scream 2
show.headline: Gorier, sexier, funnier

event.title: <show-title>Scream 2</show-title>
event.headline: Wes Craven's slasher sequel is a cut above the rest
event.description: How do you make a sequel to one of the greatest horror films of all time? By making SCREAM 2, actually. Released less than a year after the original classic, SCREAM 2 perfects the formula so carefully crafted by screenwriter Kevin Williamson to deliver a higher body count, bigger scares, and better set pieces. This time, Sidney Prescott (Neve Campbell) is in college and trying to live a normal life, but chaos erupts when Stab, a movie based on the events from the first film, inspires a series of copycat murders. Throw in a franchise-best performance from Courteney Cox as ambitious reporter Gale Weathers and a shocking killer reveal, and you've got the makings of one of the best sequels ever made. (Trace Thurman)

show.title: The Ring
show.headline: Before you die, you see...the ring

event.title: <show-title>The Ring</show-title>
event.headline: 4K restoration of the analog horror hit
event.description:
We'd follow Naomi Watts and her cursed VHS tape to the ends of the galaxy. THE RING – Gore Verbinski's expansive interpretation of the J-horror classic RINGU – is the rare horror remake that stands on its own as a singularly haunting experience. With a magnetic performance from David Lynch alumni Watts (MULHOLLAND DRIVE), a gorgeous design sensibility, and special effects by Rick Baker (VIDEODROME), it's no surprise that this movie scarred/inspired an entire generation of analog horror-heads. Or that it continues to resonate decades later.

Screening the 4K restoration

show.title: Danger: Diabolik
show.headline: Mario Bava’s pop art comic book supercriminal strikes again!

event.title: <show-title>Danger: Diabolik</show-title>
event.headline: Mario Bava’s pop art comic book supercriminal strikes again!
event.description: DANGER: DIABOLIK is Adam West's Batman made by stylish and horny European people. Very early on, Diabolik steals $10 million using multicolored gas and then spreads the cash around his giant rotating bed so he and his hot blonde girlfriend can have sex in it. Every single frame of this movie whips unbelievable ass from an aesthetic standpoint, and only further convinces me that mid-century modern Euro design is the best to ever do it. Ideal first film in a BARBARELLA double feature. (Morgan Hyde)

show.title: Legend (1985)
show.headline: Ridley Scott’s dark twisted fantasy.

event.title: <show-title>Legend (1985)</show-title>
event.headline: Ridley Scott’s dark twisted fantasy.
event.description:
After changing the game with ALIEN and BLADE RUNNER, British ad genius-turned-filmmaker Ridley Scott set his sights on a world of dungeons & dragons. When The Lord of Darkness (a devilishly brilliant Tim Curry) concocts a plan to kill the world’s remaining unicorns and kidnaps a princess (Mia Sara), it’s up to spritely Tom Cruise and his gang of creatures to save the day. A production that took up nearly all of the legendary 007 Stage at Pinewood Studios in the UK, LEGEND is a wonder of design and imagination, which sounds even better when you hear the lush Tangerine Dream score. (Jake Isgar)

35mm print of the US Theatrical Cut courtesy of Universal Pictures.

show.title: Mac and Me
show.headline: An alien trying to escape from NASA is befriended by a wheelchair-bound boy

event.title: <show-title>Mac and Me</show-title>
event.headline: Brought to you by McDonald's.
event.description:
A blatant E.T. imitation, MAC AND ME spilled onto Earth eight years after Spielberg's beloved creature, capturing zero hearts and conjuring no one's tears. Yet it found life as an amusing object, in no small part due to Paul Rudd's insistence on showing one particular clip on Late Night with Conan O'Brien. While we'd refrain from encouraging mean-hearted laughter at such a misguided movie, there is much glee to be found in the oddness of MAC AND ME. Those crazy-looking Mysterious Alien Creatures! A five-minute dance scene in McDonald's! And instead of Elliott on a bicycle, we get earnest little Eric on the run with MAC in his wheelchair!

35mm print courtesy of Park Circus.

show.title: Mystery Manga
show.headline: Some superheroes are cuter than others

event.title: <show-title>Mystery Manga</show-title>
event.headline: Mutant noir from producer Tsui Hark
event.description: Okay, we’re cheating with this one: it isn’t really based on a manga. It’s based on a novel, but you’d never know because it’s full of the types of images of be-tentacled monsters and kinetic action one would expect from a manga adaptation. This live-action Hong Kong movie followed a Japanese animated adaptation of the source novel from five years earlier, but with producer Tsui Hark behind the scenes, expect this version to push the very limits of visual comprehensibility and budget.

show.title: Popeye
show.headline: Robin Williams brings the spinach-loving sailor to life!

event.title: <show-title>Popeye</show-title>
event.headline: The comic strip marvel from ... Robert Altman ?!
event.description:
In no universe did anyone anticipate a cantankerous genius like Robert Altman to adapt a comic strip into a full-tilt musical, let alone one that we deserve. A co-production between Paramount and Disney with a ramshackle set constructed on isle of Malta, POPEYE's marriage of pop-art and poetic realism creates a rare dose of confectionary splendor. Rootin' n' tootin' sailor Popeye (Robin Williams in his film debut) washes ashore in the town of Sweethaven, falls in love with Olive Oyl (a never-better Shelley Duvall), and engages in all sorts of bare-knuckle adventures. Composed by rock god Harry Nilsson, POPEYE is the type of creative gamble that must be seen (and seen again) to believe.

DCP courtesy of Paramount Pictures.

show.title: Son of the White Mare
show.headline: The Hungarian psych-folk animation masterpiece, restored in 4k

posterImages.altText: Arbelos son of the white mare 960x1400

event.title: <show-title>Son of the White Mare</show-title>
event.headline: The Hungarian psych-folk animation masterpiece, restored in 4k
event.description:
One of the great masterpieces of world animation, SON OF THE WHITE MARE is a swirling, color-mad maelstrom of mythic monsters and Scythian heroes, part Nibelungenlied, part YELLOW SUBMARINE, lit by jagged bolts of lightning and drenched in rivers of blue, red, gold, and green.

A massive cosmic oak stands at the gates of the Underworld, holding seventy-seven dragons in its roots. To combat these monsters, a dazzling white mare goddess gives birth to three heroes – Treeshaker and his brothers – who embark on an epic journey to save the universe.

Directed by Hungarian animator Marcell Jankovics (famed for his 1974 Oscar-nominated short SISYPHUS), SON OF THE WHITE MARE has been restored in 4K using the original 35mm camera negative and sound elements by Arbelos Films, in collaboration with the Hungarian National Film Institute and Archive.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Cook, The Thief, His Wife, & Her Lover
show.headline: Peter Greenaway's verbal & visual feast

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE COOK, THE THIEF, HIS WIFE & HER LOVER

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE COOK, THE THIEF, HIS WIFE & HER LOVER

posterImages.altText: THE COOK, THE THIEF, HIS WIFE & HER LOVER

event.title: <show-title>The Cook, The Thief, His Wife, & Her Lover</show-title>
event.headline: Peter Greenaway's verbal & visual feast
event.description:
Peter Greenaway's 1989 magnum opus THE COOK, THE THIEF, HIS WIFE & HER LOVER is neo-noir for the hungry, devious soul. Released at a time when crime cinema was growing increasingly perverse with the likes of ANGEL HEART (1987), BLUE VELVET (1986), and BODY DOUBLE (1984), Greenaway's film out-shocks the buch by intertwining two of human nature's favorite pastimes: food and sex. Like Marco Ferreri's LA GRAND BOUFFE (1973) and Paul Bartel's EATING RAOUL (1982) before it, food and sex quickly turn into a recipe for something decidedly more sinister and... cannibalistic. Shocking audiences at the time of its release, time has not tamed Greenaway's film at all, and you'll never look at Helen Mirren or Michael Gambon the same way again. (Justin LaLiberty)

DCP courtesy of Universal Pictures

show.title: Torque
show.headline: Extreme motorcycle mayhem in 35mm

event.title: <show-title>Torque</show-title>
event.headline: Extreme motorcycle mayhem in 35mm
event.description:
For those who feel THE FAST AND THE FURIOUS movies have only gotten better as they've gotten more and more ridiculous, take a look back to 2004 and see that Joseph Kahn and his team beat that franchise to the NOS-injected punch. Shot like a commercial for music videos and edited within an inch of coherency, TORQUE is peak '00s extreme pop art. Indistinguishable from parody even when it's ambiguous if that's what it's up to, and still thrillingly over-the-top even when it's clear that it's making fun of itself. Don't worry, you can't get irony poisoning in just 84 brief minutes, and you'll be left wanting more of this looney tune.

35mm print courtesy of Park Circus

show.title: Possession (1981)
show.headline: A mind-bending psychosexual fever dream

event.title: <show-title>Possession (1981)</show-title>
event.headline: A mind-bending psychosexual fever dream
event.description: Something is wrong with Anna (Isabelle Adjani). Having taken a lover, she abruptly asks her husband, Mark (Sam Neill), for divorce. He's desperate for an explanation, but Anna's answers are elusive at best. She's in crisis – becoming emotional, avoidant, self-harming, and neglectful of their son. Mark has no idea, but behind her increasingly erratic behavior is a monstrous secret. The films of Andrej Zulawski lie beyond narrative, emotion, and sanity. POSSESSION is a raw depiction of the monstrosity of marital strife and the fear of female sexuality. An arthouse favorite combining existential dread with doppelgangers, blood, and body horror, POSSESSION is truly one of a kind.

event.headline: The creator of Scream brings us another sexy teen thriller
event.description: We don't just watch horror movies — we live for them. And at every Terror Tuesday, we join hands to worship at the gore-soaked altar of slash, trash, thrash, and FUN!! This eclectic series spans all centuries, covering everything from seminal horror treasures to undiscovered D.I.Y. monster-blasts. Terror Tuesday is the new ground zero for warming your black heart.

show.title: Zombie
show.headline: The dead are among us.

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Rz6b Ev Dbkch Du8 EKJSXRR Uhpxuy

posterImages.altText: MV5 B Yjhi Mj Mx ZG Et Y2 Vm ZC00 OT Vm LW Ex NT Qt Ym Uy Nj Zi ND Jl MWM4 Xk Ey Xk Fqc Gde QX Vy MT Qx Nz Mz NDI V1 F Mjpg UX1000

event.title: <show-title>Zombie</show-title>
event.headline: The one where a zombie fights a shark.
event.description:
ZOMBIE isn’t a movie -- it’s a rite of passage. Exploding from a psychological demon-void and onto a sun-drenched beach in Dimension X, this is Lucio Fulci’s valentine to minimalism, mood, and gratuitous throat-ripping. An outbreak of zombies in New York City brings Tisa “Sister of Mia” Farrow to a tropical island, where her mad scientist father works feverishly to find a cure for the zombie rampage. But everyone knows that tropical islands in Italian horror movies can only lead to one thing. And it’s not hugs. An exercise in both beautiful design and brutal nihilism, ZOMBIE appropriated George Romero’s undead mythos and transformed it into a cultural game-changer for the horror genre. P.S. Beware of sharks. (Blue Underground)

DCP courtesy of Blue Underground.

show.headline: "Not bad for a duck from Outer Space..."

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.
